title: Greek Spanakopita Slices
description: Flaky phyllo pastry filled with a savory mixture of spinach, feta, herbs and sautéed aromatics, baked until golden and crisp. Bright lemon and dill brighten the rich, tangy filling for a classic Greek savory pie served in convenient sliceable portions.

ingredients.display_name: fresh spinach, washed and coarsely chopped
ingredients.notes: Can use frozen spinach (thawed and well-drained) in equal weight
Use block feta for best texture

ingredients.display_name: phyllo pastry sheets (thawed if frozen), about 18 sheets
ingredients.notes: Standard 9x14in (approx) phyllo sheets; keep covered with a damp towel while working
Brush between phyllo layers for crisp golden finish
Adjust to taste, consider saltiness of feta

ingredients.display_name: nonstick cooking spray or extra butter for pan

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 190°C (375°F). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking pan and set aside while preparing filling.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion and sauté until translucent and soft, about until softened without browning.
Add minced garlic to the pan and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about one minute. Do not let garlic brown.
Add the chopped fresh spinach to the skillet in batches, wilting and stirring until all is cooked down and excess moisture released. Cook until wilted and most liquid has evaporated.
Transfer the spinach mixture to a colander or bowl and press or squeeze to remove as much liquid as possible using the back of a spoon or clean towel. Allow to cool slightly.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the well-drained spinach mixture with crumbled feta, beaten eggs, chopped dill, parsley if using, lemon zest, ground nutmeg, salt and pepper. Mix until evenly incorporated.

Unroll phyllo and keep covered with a damp towel. Place one sheet of phyllo in the prepared pan and brush lightly with melted butter. Repeat layering and brushing with 6 sheets total to form a sturdy base.
Spread the spinach and feta filling evenly over the layered phyllo base and level it with a spatula.
Layer remaining phyllo sheets over the filling, brushing each sheet and repeating until about 6-8 sheets remain for the top; brush the last top sheet well with butter.
Using a sharp knife, score the assembled spanakopita into 8 equal slices to make cutting easier after baking and to allow steam to escape.
Bake in the preheated oven until phyllo is deep golden brown and crisp on top, and filling is set, about 30 to 35 minutes depending on oven. Rotate pan halfway if your oven has hot spots.
Remove from oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes to set before slicing fully and serving warm or at room temperature.
